description: Students survey politics, religion, and society from the Reformation through the era of the
Glorious Revolution.  Using both contemporary authors and historical writings, students examine
the reigns of Henry VIII and Elizabeth I, the introduction of Protestantism, the Anglican Church
and its puritan critics, the conflict between the Stuart kings and parliament, the revolutions of
the 17th century, and the establishment of liberty for conscience.  Offered periodically.
